result.execSummary:
The defendant Ivan L Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
09-15-2016/ Judge Timothy M Witkowiak
The Huber privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, AODA treatment, school.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge  are to be paid by 7/28/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample, pay relates surcharge.
Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are  restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivan L Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: reflects 09-15-16 court order cancelling Huber privileges

Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Witkowiak Br 22 for review. os

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 6 days, Huber privileges for work, AODA treatment, school. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Work or school part time
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/28/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/28/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction.
Sentence to commence FORTHWITH.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Ivan L Boyd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Ivan L Boyd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense counsel wants to speak with ADA Glamm regarding a Deferred Prosecution. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/28/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Ivan L Boyd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ivan L Boyd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping..

Defendant Ivan L Boyd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
